{"step_by_step_thinking": "Alpha-fetoprotein (AFP) is a protein produced by the yolk sac and the liver during fetal development. It is thought to be the fetus's version of serum albumin. AFP levels in a pregnant woman can show if her baby may have birth defects. It's important to note that AFP is present in different concentrations in different parts of the body. While it is produced by the fetus, it can be found in the amniotic fluid, maternal serum, and placenta. However, since it is produced by the fetus, the highest concentration should be in the fetal serum.", "answer_choice": "A"}
